name: General Purpose
description: The XGP data type is a flexible, general-purpose composite data type designed to accommodate various structured data requirements that are not covered by other specific HL7 data types. It provides a framework for representing custom or specialized data structures while maintaining HL7 message integrity and interoperability. XGP enables healthcare systems to extend HL7 messaging capabilities for unique organizational needs, vendor-specific requirements, and evolving healthcare data standards.

XGP.1.name: Set ID
XGP.1.description: Sequential identifier for multiple instances of the general purpose data type within a message. Enables ordering and identification of repeated XGP elements.

XGP.2.name: Data Type
XGP.2.description: Identifies the specific type or category of data being represented. Provides context for interpreting the remaining components appropriately.

XGP.3.name: Data Value
XGP.3.description: The primary data value or content. This component contains the main information being conveyed in the general purpose structure.

XGP.4.name: Data Description
XGP.4.description: Human-readable description or label for the data value. Provides context and meaning for understanding the data content.

XGP.5.name: Data Source
XGP.5.description: Identifies the source system, application, or authority responsible for the data. Provides traceability and validation context.

XGP.6.name: Date/Time Stamp
XGP.6.description: Timestamp indicating when the data was created, modified, or became effective. Supports temporal tracking and versioning.
